channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel says body returned by Hamas not that of hostage
item.description: Israel identified the remains of child hostages but said another body from Hamas was not their mother as claimed. And near Tel Aviv, explosions hit threes buses, but no injuries were reported.
item.content:encoded:
Israel identified the remains of child hostages but said another body from Hamas was not their mother as claimed. And near Tel Aviv, explosions hit threes buses, but no injuries were reported.

(Image credit: Mahmoud Illean)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Israel says returned body isn't a hostage. And, FEMA cuts building code efforts
item.description: FEMA has cut employees and is now halting efforts to improve building codes. And, Israel says one of the bodies Hamas returned does not belong to any known hostage.
item.content:encoded:
FEMA has cut employees and is now halting efforts to improve building codes. And, Israel says one of the bodies Hamas returned does not belong to any known hostage.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: What even IS art? The quiz doesn't know â€” but do you?
item.description: Plus: Why are there so many "Bridget Jones" movies? Who all resigned over the Eric Adams drama? And what phrase originated on "SNL"?
item.content:encoded: Plus: Why are there so many "Bridget Jones" movies? Who all resigned over the Eric Adams drama? And what phrase originated on "SNL"?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: What to know about the case against former Spanish soccer head Luis Rubiales
item.description: The former president of Spain's soccer federation was found guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso after the 2023 women's World Cup. Here's what to know about the case.
item.content:encoded:
The former president of Spain's soccer federation was found guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso after the 2023 women's World Cup. Here's what to know about the case.

(Image credit: Chema Moya)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: In case you missed it: Here's what happened with Trump this week, from Ukraine to DOGE
item.description: NPR rounds up what happened this week, the fourth week of President Trump's administration, and takes a look at some developments that have been overlooked.
item.content:encoded:
NPR rounds up what happened this week, the fourth week of President Trump's administration, and takes a look at some developments that have been overlooked.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Measles cases are rising in the U.S. Do adults need a vaccine booster?
item.description: With a measles outbreak growing in West Texas, and cases popping up across the country, experts say vaccination is your best protection. And it's not just for kids. Some adults may need a booster.
item.content:encoded:
With a measles outbreak growing in West Texas, and cases popping up across the country, experts say vaccination is your best protection. And it's not just for kids. Some adults may need a booster.

(Image credit: Natalya Maisheva)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: A far-right influencer is getting invitations to travel with Trump Cabinet members
item.description: Jack Posobiec, a prominent influencer, has a long history of promoting antisemitic and white supremacist content. He traveled to Ukraine with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent last week.
item.content:encoded:
Jack Posobiec, a prominent influencer, has a long history of promoting antisemitic and white supremacist content. He traveled to Ukraine with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent last week.

(Image credit: Dominic Gwinn)
item.dc:creator: Lisa Hagen

item.title: Australia warns airlines to beware of Chinese naval exercises in the Tasman Sea
item.description: China had given notice that its warships could potentially fire live weapons during an exercise in the Tasman Sea, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said.
item.content:encoded:
China had given notice that its warships could potentially fire live weapons during an exercise in the Tasman Sea, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump's picks to oversee Medicare and biomedical research will divest stock
item.description: Dr. Mehmet Oz, nominated to run the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, will sell shares in Eli Lilly and UnitedHealth. Dr. Jay Bhattacharya, NIH nominee, will shed stock in Walmart and Nvidia.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Mehmet Oz, nominated to run the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, will sell shares in Eli Lilly and UnitedHealth. Dr. Jay Bhattacharya, NIH nominee, will shed stock in Walmart and Nvidia.

(Image credit: Jeff Swensen)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Justice Department broadens Jan. 6 pardons to cover gun, drug-related charges
item.description: In a new development, the Department of Justice said Trump's pardon of Jan. 6 defendants should apply more broadly and include separate gun charges, as well.
item.content:encoded:
In a new development, the Department of Justice said Trump's pardon of Jan. 6 defendants should apply more broadly and include separate gun charges, as well.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach
